title: What are some good examples of the ripple effect in modern life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Our New Year Resolutions The enthusiasm to accomplish the goals which we set on the night of 31st December is highest(Like you see in the starting of ripple effect) and then it starts decreasing slowly day by day.(Just like the way  post-initial waves are in ripple effect) Then there is one point when you have no evidence to prove that you actually had a goal in your mind and you were working towards it. This is the point where the ripple ends and water is calm as usual.

Here are some of my observations: our buying decision or behaviour (thanks to the digital and online retail world) has started following a ripple effect. It just takes that one buyer to rate a product as excellent or give a favourable review for it to be bought by thousands of other forming a ripple effect.Crowdfunding is a ripple effect feature where through a single platform you have the ability to reach out to millions.Hope it helps
